about:2: SuttaCentral is a website run by a small team, originally based in Australia. We have no institutional affiliation, but are just a group of friends interested in the Suttas. The founders were Rod Bucknell, John Kelly, and Bhante Sujato. The project leader is Bhante Sujato. Financial support for the site comes from the SuttaCentral Development Trust, a non-profit charity incorporated in Australia.
about:3: SuttaCentral aims at facilitating the study of Buddhist texts from comparative and historical perspectives. It focuses on “Early Buddhist texts”. These are preserved in the Pali Sutta and Vinaya Piṭakas as well as in ancient Chinese and Tibetan translations and in fragmentary remains in Sanskrit and other languages.
about:4: SuttaCentral offers a gateway to this material by enabling users to quickly identify the Chinese, Tibetan, and/or Sanskrit parallels of any given Pali discourse, or vice versa. Having found that information, one can consult the actual texts or view available translations.
about:5: The project is much more than a website, as we support an ongoing effort to create new translations in many languages with our Bilara translation app. Selected translations are also available in book form.
about:6: SuttaCentral is under constant development and updates are made regularly. To keep up with what’s new, check the Updates category in our forum.
about:8: SuttaCentral does not have advertising or tracking. We do not collect any personal data on users without your knowledge and consent. All our pages are served over secure, encrypted connections.
